reasoning: Childhood absence epilepsy (CAE) incidence ~7-8 per 100k children annually. Well-defined clinical entity with specific electroencephalographic and clinical presentation. Primarily pediatric onset with peak age 4-8 years. Global estimate based on epidemiological studies from developed countries with potential underdiagnosis in resource-limited regions.
source: Jalava M et al. (1997). Incidence of childhood absence epilepsy in Finland. Epilepsia. 38(5):600-604; Loiseau P et al. (1990). Epidemiology of absence epilepsy in France. Epilepsia. 31(2):130-136
